attachments.title: Community Update - December 2020
attachments.text: Community Update - December 2020 Summary Our teams are working to coordinate the many individuals and organizations that have offered to help advance The Rocky Linux Foundation, Inc. (Rocky Linux). The core team is working to lay the infrastructure that will support the legal entity and the engineering efforts required to deliver and support an initial release. Updates regarding project news, release dates, and more will be announced on our forums, website, and other social media platforms. Tim...
attachments.fallback: Rocky Linux Discourse: Community Update - December 2020

messages.text: Gotta admire the fact that they are already planning for merch

elements.text: Gotta admire the fact that they are already planning for merch

messages.text: > We have outgrown Slack due to the size of the community and required feature sets, and will therefore be migrating to Mattermost 111. This open source platform has a number of features we’ll be taking advantage of, including: an IRC bridge, multi-factor authentication, advanced logging / auditing / security capabilities, and fidelity in channel and access permissions.

elements.text: We have outgrown Slack due to the size of the community and required feature sets, and will therefore be migrating to Mattermost 111. This open source platform has a number of features we’ll be taking advantage of, including: an IRC bridge, multi-factor authentication, advanced logging / auditing / security capabilities, and fidelity in channel and access permissions.

messages.text: <@UDB26738Q>, <@U67BJLYCS> and I were talking about the next steps for Spack integration, and I thought it might be time to actually sit down and write out the next step of JLLWrappers functionality

elements.text: and I were talking about the next steps for Spack integration, and I thought it might be time to actually sit down and write out the next step of JLLWrappers functionality

messages.text: Here’s what I’m thinking we want to do: We want to have JLLWrappers generate bindings that are instrumented in almost every conceivable way with `Preferences.jl`, such that the user can override all sorts of things.  The first thing I was thinking it would be useful to support overriding is the filename of Library Products

elements.text: Here’s what I’m thinking we want to do: We want to have JLLWrappers generate bindings that are instrumented in almost every conceivable way with
, such that the user can override all sorts of things.  The first thing I was thinking it would be useful to support overriding is the filename of Library Products

messages.text:
I think this is important for two reasons:

* I’d like to use it to support “just load my system library”.  We can even use this mode by default for people who build Julia with `USE_SYSTEM_XXX=1`.
* It’s necessary for spack, but we don’t want to blindly load anything in Spack-land, we want to load the exact version that Spack gives us.

elements.text:

messages.text: yes, once we can override filename and path, I think we can do anything, right?

elements.text: yes, once we can override filename and path, I think we can do anything, right?
